name: Shangri-La Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. It is 10 minutes walk from Orchard Road but is on such a quite street. The hotel is fabulous. We got upgraded to the Valley Wing with free champagne and all the cocktails, snacks and drinks we could have everyday. Also included a really good breakfast. The hotel itself is out of this world. I must also highly praise all the staff as every single person we interacted with was super nice.
reviews.title: A fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Shangri-La on the first part of our honeymoon in July. After 22 hours travelling from the UK we arrived at the hotel around 9am to find a mix-up with our booking. We had booked a Valley Wing Room on the hotel's website & when we arrived they said we had booked into the Garden Wing and the Valley Wing was full. After tears from me and several cups of tea later, the manager of the Valley Wing arrived and apologised and said they had found us a room in the Valley Wing. We were so happy as we had wanted the free champagne option as a perfect start to our honeymoon. The manager took us to our room and they had arranged a cake, champagne and a beautiful heart of petals on the bed. Over the 3 days, Sandro (the GM) and all his staff couldn't do enough for us. Sandro also gave us a $25 voucher on the last morning to use in one of the restaurants. I would rate this hotel 6 stars and although we had a bad experience at check in, they couldn't do enough to rectify it. I would highly recommend the Valley Wing as the champagne and canapes are great. The breakfast in the Summit room is lovely and they cooked my husband his own personal breakfast (and remembered that he hates tomatoes on the 2nd morning). We ate in the Line restaurant several nights and the buffet is amazing. The pool is lovely although it can get quite crowded esp late afternoons.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.liked: — Service, Food & Drink, close to Orchard Rd, Fabulous staff

reviews.text: If we ever go back to Singapore I wouldn't stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a very good location close to the main street, shops and restaurants. It is also very quiet. They have excellent breakfast buffet. I stayed in many hotels that offered breakfast, but this was by far the best. The stuff is very helpful and nice. Service was also great. I would stay there again. This was probably the best hotel experience I had and I stayed there for a month.
reviews.title: I have a couple of remarks

reviews.text: Our room was a bit musty from the humidity, this could be better attended to by maintenance.
reviews.title: This hotel could do with an upgrade of facilities

reviews.text: I guess this hotel has won all the possible awards there are. I have stayed at three room types lately: standard Tower Wing room, Horizon Club in the Tower Wing, and this time in a Garden Wing room.
reviews.title: Good but not fantastic

reviews.text: One attribute for all the rooms is: a bit old. I mean everything is clean, staff is nice, location is fine, but the rooms just feel a bit old to call this a great hotel. My current room in the Garden Wing was nice but the traffice noise (I was on 5th floor just above the road the taxis take to the reception) was a bit loud. Nice touch was the separate reception - my travel agent just did not tell me about that.
reviews.title: A lush oasis in Singapore

reviews.text: The Horizon Club room was enormous and the special reception upstairs exclusive. But again... a bit old.
reviews.title: A heaven on earth

reviews.text: However, the pool is great - big enough for exercise, the gym is one of the best in hotels I have seen, the massage in the health club was good, and the breakfast in the Line was superb.
reviews.title: my very favourite hotel

reviews.text: Staff was one of the best in the world.
reviews.title: Shangri La Singapore certainly has the wow factor

reviews.text: The rooms at the Shangri-La were absolutely beautiful. Really modern and clean with a nice free fruit and chocolate basket waiting! Book a high floor to get a great room and great service. Must visit The Line Restaurant for an experience like no other. Chefs cooking different cuisines from around the world will whip up whatever you want from ingredients on display that you can choose. It's kinda like a buffet, you just walk around to different stations and order or take whatever you want. The dessert station is fabbo! Don't book in the resort area - those rooms didn't look very nice. Stay in the corporate tower.
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms & Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner arrived at the Shangri-la early in the morning around 7.30am. Thought of keeping our luggage at the concierge and then come back to check in later. I was attended by their Manager. Very kind of him to let me check in eventhough it was very early. He then showed us to our room. Room was spacious and well decorated.
reviews.title: Loved the Shangri-la

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Standard of the service in this hotel were awesome. Staffs greeted you by name. Professional and attentive.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!

likes.disliked: — I liked everything; maybe the pool area is a little bit small for the size of the hotel but apart from this everything is great!

reviews.title: Good Service
reviews.text: We stayed at this Hotel for a second time on our way to Langkawi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights and had a Tower room, we did have a couple of small problems when we arrived, but these were soon sorted out by Janet one of the Assistant Managers.
reviews.title: One of the Best in the World

likes.liked: — Quiet elegance, curteous and friendly staff and caring staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is excellent as is the location and the Blu Resturant is definatly worth a visit, food and views great.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again and would recommend it for anyone looking for qaulity and service.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just spent 5 days in the acclaimed Valley Wing of this hotel. It is true to say that everything that has been described about this hotel from the greetings and check in on arrival to the beautiful room and equally superb staff, we found to be absolutley accurate. We could not fault anything and we did try!.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! This was amazing! We stayed here because of reviews on here and were not disappointed! I, however, have not stayed in many really plush hotels - so maybe that negates my opinion a little?!
reviews.title: Unbelievable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the Valley Wing where nothing is too much trouble. We enjoyed the complimentary canapes and drinks that were served every day in the lounge. There is a separate entrance for residents of the wing and the reception is stunning.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: The room was gorgeous - large bathroom and bed, beautiful view of the pool, very spacious. It was serviced at several points during the day, including when they turn down your bed for the night and leave handmade chocolates on the pillows. There were even business cards printed up with my name on them and left in the desk drawer.
reviews.title: Bring your wallet

likes.liked: — Spacious, clean room. Large Pool. Impressive foyer and restaurant
likes.disliked: — Prices of everything...and I wasn't even paying!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were amazingly helpful - tipping is expected for certain services, such as the porter.
reviews.title: The best

reviews.text: The only thing I would say is that it IS expensive - and there were a few charges that we hadn't thought about such as the tax that they add to your total bill, and the gratuities that get automatically added to every service that you use. (For example, they add gratuity for the room service if I remember rightly).
reviews.title: Loved Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Shangri LA on our way home from a five week trip to Australia. We had pre -booked but when we arrived we decided to upgrade to the Valley winf (for not a huge amount of money). This allowed us free champers and food and an upgrade to a suite.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was magnificent; the staff friendly and the location superb.
reviews.title: Amazing start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: We stayed over Christmas and enjoyed the celebrations on Xmas eve on Orchard road.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: All in all a great place to be.
reviews.title: MEH... aging beauty... one generation too old

reviews.text: Arrived on the 27th December after a long flight with Singapore Airways (amazing airline!), greeted by great staff, swift check in with no problems.Great rooms, a little business like, but hey when you're staying in a capital city... it's always going to feel a little like that.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First hotel in our honeymoon as a 2 night stopover to Australia.
reviews.title: Loved the line restaurant but annoyed about a late/wrong minibar charge
5 Star Luxury
reviews.text: Great welcome and check in, very helpful in cutting the lock on our case after we lost our key.
We stayed in the Garden wing, think slightly bigger room and lots of greenery on balcony etc.
reviews.title: The 'Valley Wing' - Heaven in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights
reviews.title: Horizon Club is a disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good welcome on arrival
reviews.title: Super rest at Shangri La
honeymoon bliss??
reviews.text: the Shangrila Singapore is must stay destination in Singapore. just up from Orchard Rd it is ideally situated. It may not be the cheapest but it is the best. Just check out the chandeliers in the lobby! Limo pickups are easliy arranged. SERVICE is guaranteed and every possible food combination is available for breakfast alone. The stunning pool area has artistic ambience, especially at night! Warm tropical and romantic, you couldnt find a nicer or more luxurious stay. Upgrade to the garden wing for the extra little priveleges. You dont need to be on your honeymoon to stay there but it will seem like it before you leave. Opulent luxurtY and fist class service and facilites. Everty amenity is available. One negative word, - dont try the poolside pizza!!
I have stayed there 3 times already. Go on spoil yourself!!!!! YOU are guaranteed to return!
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed here a second time for the start of our honeymoon and we could not have asked for a better start to the holiday. We upgraded to the Valley Wing and it was worth every penny. The lounge includes Moet champagne and yummy cocktails free flowing from 10am until 11pm, afternoon tea with freshly baked scones and finger sandwiches, a la carte breakfast. the staff were very attentive but not overly so. The room was fantastic very comfortable, a great view with large window, extremely comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, close to Orchard Road. Although we did get out and about we couldnt wait to get back to the welcoming comforts of the hotel after a long day. The outdoor pool is wonderful a nice place to relax. Everything was Perfect! And we had a yummy chocolate mousse cake delivered to the room as a honeymoon gift.
reviews.title: A great Singapore choice

reviews.text: Stayed at the Singapore Shang recently in the Garden wing. This is a beautiful hotel from all aspects. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed and most importantly the bed was comfortable. Ate in two of the restaurants; the cafe has a great dinner buffet which includes a variety of Indian, Chinese, western and seafood choices (including lobster), the Blu restaurant on the top floor is a fine dining choice and although good quality comes at a hefty price. Service through out was without fault.
reviews.title: Kids loved the pool

reviews.text: I cannot think of a better hotel gym and the automated climbing wall makes for an interesting work out. The pool is huge(lagoon style approx 100m in length) and suitable for laps or relaxing and the gardens, especially the waterfall garden in the garden wing, are beautiful. Although not located on Orchard Rd it is only a 10 min walk down the road but would advise taking an umbrella as the weather can turn pretty quickly which we found out.
reviews.title: Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Shangri-La is an excellent hotel. This was my wife’s and my third stay here in the last year. Set in a treed residential area only a 1km shuttle bus ride from Orchard Road shops, the Shangri-La offers near-resort ambience and facilities for business and leisure travellers. Entering the vast lobby, the mature tropical trees and pool around which the hotel is built on three sides are already on view through ceiling-height windows.
reviews.title: A great hotel... and the food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you are economising on an overnight stay, forgo the rather bland Tower rooms and take a spacious Garden Wing Pool-View room with balcony to make the most of the palm tree and rainforest surroundings and to have more direct access to the outdoor areas. Our room was meticulously equipped and maintained. The large lagoon pool, popular in the Singapore heat, includes a good area for children, and there are tennis courts and a gym.
reviews.title: Super hotel......except....

likes.disliked: — Empty pool loungers reserved with towels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A memorable aspect was the seriously good cooking in the three hotel restaurants we tried. The two-course Peking Duck in the Shang Palace Chinese restaurant was as good as we have had anywhere. The small lunch buffet in the Rose Veranda, easily missed in its mezzanine location overlooking the garden, had a great range of taste treats being constantly refreshed. But the showstopper is the “The Line” restaurant, an ultra-modern design tour de force on the pool level that is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A la carte is available for the weary, but take the buffet option and stroll around the sixteen “theatre kitchens”, marvelling at and sampling the staggering variety of top quality eastern and western dishes on offer. The whole experience is fun for diners of all ages. We sat on after dinner, just enjoying the buzz of the place.
reviews.title: A perfect end to our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff throughout were friendly and efficient. We really felt at home throughout our stay. Drinks of all kinds are expensive, as are business centre charges. Nevertheless we would recommend this hotel absolutely without hesitation.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: ....they forgot to send the limo to collect us from the airport!
reviews.title: Still the Best in Singapore but with a small complaint

likes.disliked: — Some taxi drivers do not know where the Valley Wing is!

reviews.text: The Shangri-la is a good hotel, no doubts on that. However, it doesn't deserve the premium positioning and pricing it seems to occupy. We'd booked a Horizon Club room, but since the hotel was full we ended up getting a standard lower flloor room instead of the Horizon Club Floor.
reviews.title: Extremely Over-priced for what you get

reviews.text: We were later moved to another room on the Club Floor but this was a strangely shaped corner room without a separate shower stall in the bathroom - the website advertises all rooms as having a separate shower stall. And on 2 days, the international paper we had requested was not delivered and we had to request it twice after which we got the local paper. Small issues, i know, but you don't expect these in a hotel of this class and cost.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and services are good and comfortable, but nothing special. The location is also poor, a long walk from Orchard Road's major shopping areas, no public transport or pretty much anything else nearby.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel- Pure Luxury & Wonderful Staff/ Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental last month at half the price and I would rate that stay on par with or slightly better than my stay this time at the Shangri-la. Stay somewhere else, it's not worth paying so much for the brand name.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: we stayed here on october 14th for 3 nights with our family,we read the reviews on here first and we were not disappointed with anything at all.the staff,rooms,pool were all great and the fitness centre was good too.Be sure to try breakfast at the line resteraunt at least once,you will be amazed.fantastic hotel that i would recommend to anybody.
reviews.title: Superb !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a nine night stay in the Valley Wing of Shangri-La Singapore. Arrived and was shown to our stunning room by the assistant manager where we completed a very speedy check in, had a quick freshen up and then went for our first visit to the champagne bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic and Fabuolus

likes.liked: — Everything from our room, the amazing friendly staff, the food and of course the champagne bar

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and had the most beautiful bathroom with twin sinks, large powerful shower, sunken bath with a television built in at the end of it and the toilet and bidet were in a separate small room. Every day the fruit bowl was replenished and every night a box with a chocolate was left for us. There was even a pillow menu with a choice of anti snore, lavender filled etc.
reviews.title: Good yes, great no

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included when you stay at the Valley Wing and can be taken in either the private Summit room or in The Line resturant, we used the summit room every day where there was a buffet of cereals, fruit, cold meats and cheeses and pastriesand then there is the menu oh my goodness are you spoiled for choice from traditional Japanese and Chinese breakfasts to the full cooked English, waffles served with banana and berries with maple butter, pancakes with berries and French toast served with bacon berries and honey. The staff are wonderfull and after a couple of days remember your preference for tea, coffee white or brown toast.
reviews.title: Absolute Class!

reviews.text: The Champagne Bar in the lobby is fantastic no matter what time of day ( I think between 11 and 10.30 ) you come in you hear the popping of champagne corks Edward and his team of butlers are there to see that your glass is never empty ( or at least not for very long ) of course you can also have beer, wine, spirtis, cocktails and soft drinks try the Singapore Sling you wont be disappointed careful tho as they are strong!!! Tea, coffee and hot chocolate are also readily available as the the selection of snacks afternoon tea, cheese and biscuits and canapes.
reviews.title: Genuine Touch

likes.liked: — Attention to detail on almost all guest experiences
likes.disliked: — Some live music would be nice in central foyer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is lovely to pass a morning or afternoon its very shady with lots of palms and plants surrounding it and waiters come around with slices of fruit and cold towels a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a FANTASTIC hotel, that more than exceeded our expectations. We stayed in one of the tower wing rooms which was more than adequate. Fantastic views from the bedroom windows, great air conditioning etc . We ate at Shang palace, and had an excellent cantonese meal. Breakfast at The Line is outstanding, a foodies dream come true! Location is ok due to the shuttle bus service to orchard road, and the very reasonable priced taxi service. Whilst staying in sinapore we visited the botanic gardens, beautiful, which included a fantasic orchard garden for an extra charge. We also went to the night safari which was a new take on a zoo visit, flying squirrels were fantastic! Overall, we stayed in singapore for 4 nights, before moving on to bali, and were so impressed with the high standards found throughout. The staff at shangri-la are organised, kind, welcoming, polite and very gracious. We cant waite to return.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time we checked in until our check out we had a wonderful time at this hotel. Service is beyond what we would have expected. At all times we were treated with such courtesy and kindness. Nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in a Horizon Club room which was serviced twice a day and was very clean and well supplied. Breakfast at the Horizon Club is a great start to the day and we received fantastic service from Barak each morning. In the afternoons Zul and Fairoz were extremely hospitable. The Horizon Club food is delicious and beautifully presented and they are very generous with drinks. We received wonderful advice regarding tourist attractions and restaurants. Fairoz was a wealth of information and we had a great night at Newton Circus on his recommendation. If you go there make sure you try the bbq stingray and chilli lobster from Stall 2. Fantastic! We loved Singapore and would love to return to the Shangri La with our children. The hotel provided such wonderful service, was very clean and well furnished. We found it to be in a perfect location for us. An easy walk to Orchard Road but in a lovely quiet street. Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Loved the place. Very nice room. Pity I was travelling alone and on business, would love to go back on a vacation! Staff was helpful and polite. Room service is great, didnt have to wait long for anything. Ate at Summit once and liked it.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in Singapore and in the Shangri La Singapore. The first thing that we noticed when we walked into the main lobby was that there wasn't a nice scent in the hotel, unlike Intercontinental Singapore which had a lemon grass scent in the hotel ( we had just completed our stay at Intercontintal Singapore). The main lobby was very big. Nothing special. I had booked a horizon club premier room. The check in was very smooth and the lady was very polite. I asked her if they didn't use a nice scent in this hotel like the Intercontinental. She told me that they normally do have a 'Shangri La' scent. The doormen brought us (with our luggage) to our room and explained how everything worked. As a welcome there was fresh tea in our room. It was a nice gesture, but the tea was already cold. The room was very spacious and clean and it had a nice view. We went to the horizon club for a drink and a snack. We weren't satisfied with the room and the horizon club. The reason was that I've read many reviews about the 'luxurious' 5 star Shangri La Singapore. Don't get me wrong, it isn't bad, but it wasn't luxurious or special. It didn't felt like 5 a star hotel. For the price I was paying, I wasn't content with the room and the extra's one can get at the horizon club.
reviews.title: Go for the Valley Wing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I went to the reception and asked if I could see the rooms in the Valley Wing. The lady was very helpfull and gave me a nice tour in the Valley Wing (She showed me a bedroom, the lounge area and the breakfast area: the Summit room).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, on nostalgic trip

reviews.text: This was to be the highlight of my trip, i'd seen the pictures on the website, thought the hotel and grounds looked fantastic couldn't wait to stay.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we had been booked into a twin room (hotel fault, not travel agent), they were unable to move us, showed us 3 different rooms and in the end charged us to upgrade to a 'larger' room. Check in took approx 1 hour which isn't what you need after a 12 hour flight. A lack of good English spoken at reception didn't help matters. No apology for the incorrect booking,...nothing
reviews.title: Impressed by my first Shangri-La Experience !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that the hotel was very nice, although it's public areas do seem to have an identity crisis. Is it a bar or a restaurant? Trying to get served at the groundfloor bar/noodle reataurant / sushi?? whatever, was a nightmare.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, amazing service

likes.liked: — Everything. One of the best hotels we've stayed in in the world.

reviews.text: The penthouse bar was nice, good cocktails, excellent views.
reviews.title: Excellent - As always at ShangriLa

reviews.text: But our stay was marred by the check in. It really irked me.
reviews.title: Shangri-la at a price!

reviews.text: What a wonderful atmosphere and a great room for a great price. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. The room was gorgeous. Service was exceptional.
reviews.title: Great 5-Star Hotel

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at this fabulous hotel during a recent business trip. Excellant service and staff. Rooms are large and standard of cleanlines is very high. Wifi access free throughout the hotel with great connectivity. Hotel is within walking distance of the Orchard Road shopping area, however I believe the hotel also offer a free shuttle service.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: Hotel has a gym and swimming pool. Buffet breakfast was great, with a huge choice and fresh products.
reviews.title: Superbly comfortable

reviews.text: As my departure flight was at 11pm, the hotel allowed freshing up in the health club, with towels etc provided for shower.
reviews.title: Great location. Nice rooftop bar. Dated rooms but being renovated.

reviews.text: Would definately return to this hotel for both business and pleasure.
reviews.title: great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time in Singapore. We chose to stay comfortable at a nice hotel and discover the city quietly with no rush. We stayed there 5 nights and booked a room called Horizon Premier at the executive level of the Tower Wing.
reviews.title: Great first stay at Shangri-La SIN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rate included access to the executive lounge, free Wifi (in all places of the hotel – and speed was OK) and breakfast either at the lounge or at basement where you have access to a buffet breakfast which is quite amazing. Different cuisine style: Japanese, Chinese and international. All you can think of including an ice cream bar... The only negative point is the coffee quality: horrible. Ask for a freshly brewed coffee instead – much better!
reviews.title: Excellent but expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only tested the restaurant for dinner and we chose the buffet again. We usually don’t like buffets for dinner, but in this case this was truly a wonderful try. Again you can taste different type of cuisine: Indian, Chinese, Japanese (sushis and sashimis excellent), French, Italian. You wish to have two stomachs! Desserts are French style and very good.
reviews.title: Very nice and luxurious hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is excellent, room cleaned and refilled with mineral water and L’Occitane amenities in the bathroom.
reviews.title: If only

reviews.text: Be cautious with the bed as it is very hard. You can feel your back at the end of the night.
reviews.title: Mutton dressed as lamb

reviews.text: I stayed here for two days. On arrival, the staff were attentive, even escorting me from the taxi to the reception and arranging for my bags to be sent to the room directly. Check-in was efficient and friendly, although the staff did not bother to offer any information on the hotel facilities. I had to find this out myself by hunting down the literature once in the room. The hotel itself is well maintained with a wide range of dining and relaxation possibilities.
reviews.title: Plush but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the windows could not be opened, the air in the room tended to be stuffy. The air conditioning system did not help and gave me a headache, so I switched it off. However, the room was large, the bed comfortable and the bathroom well appointed and clean. Room service breakfast was delivered quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in the Valley Wing. What a fabulous part of a great hotel. It has its own lobby, free champagne bar and absolutely fantastic service - an amazing USP.
reviews.title: Shangri La is a Heaven and Haven on Earth

likes.liked: — Everything - one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

reviews.title: Super Hotel Shangri la Singapore
reviews.text: The impressive lobby with the chic and elegant relaxing areas have superb and friendly staff. The breakfast is served in the sumptuous Summit Room. The comfortable seating areas are serviced all day with snacks, nibbles and canpes with free flowing champagne or what ever else you want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was enormous with a carpet thick enough to sleep on. Big bathroom with nice toiletries and extras. Lovely turn down service with scrummy chocolates each night. A truely wonderful stay.
reviews.title: a stay to remember

reviews.text: My husband and I are presently on an extended trip to Australia and Malaysia. We started our trip with a three night stay in Singapore at the Shangri La hotel and what a hotel. We arrived at 7.30am after a long over night flight with the superb Singapore Airlines to find our room ready. We had a swift check in and were able to freshen up and have breakfast. Throughout our stay we enjoyed excellent service with one blot on the copy book. We decided to have a meal in the Blu restaurant which is extreemly overpriced, has very slow service and we were nearly overcharged by $200 for a bottle of wine.The restaurant was fairly quiet and every table made some kind of complaint. In comparrison on our last night we ate in the excellent Line restaurant which had a seafood evening and the food and service was second to none. So all in all well done to the Shangri La but avoid the Blu restaurant.
reviews.title: The lap of luxury

likes.disliked: — Big conference hotel, so can get overrun with delegates

reviews.text: had the pleasure of passing through singapore and i stayed at the valley wing from start to finish it was a stay to remember all the staff the food the drinks and i promised to mention the floor butlers as they like to be called they excell in their work and nothing is to much for them ,yes the hotel is a little dearer but belive me when all the above is included that is service ,snacks .afternoon tea ,evening drinks ,top class rooms,and lots more just to have the pleasure of dealing with all the staff and nothing else it would have been good value spend a little more and see what you get alan billington
reviews.title: I was on business, but felt like a vacation.

reviews.text: As a regular business traveller to Singapore I always look forward to staying at the Shangri-La. Great service, attention to detail and the ever present taxi-hailer - make it feel like coming home.
reviews.title: Opulent Asia in Singapore

reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and comfortable with quiet aircon and welcoming tea and fruit. Room service is of a good standard and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: It did not disappoint!

reviews.text: One improvement could be to remember details such as non-smoking preferences - I had to really push for the hotel to move me to a non-smoking room, which they did have available, though at a higher level. Given i was checking in at midnight, for just one night, I really was disappointed that I had to push - who else would have taken the room at that time!
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and excellent services, like most Shangri-la hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, generally no complaints and a great hotel with a few extras that you don't always find in Singapore.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from spending New Year 2012 at this Shangri-La Hotel. It really was excellent and New Year's Eve was a fantastic experience: great food, great entertainment (fantastic band) and great service. We can really recommend Blu (their restaurant on the top floor) - we had one of the best meals we have EVER had there ... the chef is superb! It's expensive but worth it for a special occasion. The main restaurant is great for breakfast. The staff are all helpful and smiling and the service is good. The hotel is ideally situated just 10 mins walk from the top of Orchard Road, so near enough to walk but far enough away to avoid all the noise. They are currently renovating one of their wings - so it is a little noisy - but this will be finished by May 2012. A great trip to a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: We stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel Singapore, and it was one of the most amazing hotels that we have ever stayed in. The Line Buffet was excellent for food and in the afternoons and evenings there was a chocolate fountain set up. The pool area was fantastic and the pool was very big and clean. The rooms were beautiful. Overall a fantastic stay.
reviews.title: World Class Hotel!!

reviews.text: The Shangri-La Singapore is a luxurious experience that really makes a holiday. We were last here two years ago and it was good then, but now it's fantastic in every way. From the costumed doorman who cheerily greets you to the friendly reception staff, it's clear the hotel administration has put a lot of effort into making your stay memorable.
reviews.title: Better than ever

reviews.text: Everything here is great fun - it's worth paying a little more for a Horizon Club room which includes daily drinks and restaurant-quality food on the 24th floor overlooking the horizon across Singapore.
reviews.title: dreadful

reviews.text: And there's no better five star big city hotel breakfast anywhere in the world than at the famous Line Restaurant here at the Shangri La. Such variety and delicious food to start the day off well. It was fun wandering down to the pool in our fluffy white bathrobes and white slippers...the pool area is also very attractive and surrounded by greenery and palms desipite being so close to the Orchard Rd shopping precinct.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Thanks to the people at the Shangri-La who have made this such a distinctive, pleasurable experience. The Shangri-La truly belongs at #1 in Singapore.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel... would stay here again.

reviews.text: Please have a lot at your room service. Needs some upgrade.
reviews.title: A fantastic anniversary weekend!

reviews.text: This hotel could do with a major upgrade of facilities ; it feels old and could therefore do with a major renovation. Overall, not a good package for either the business or leisure traveller.
reviews.title: Thank you singapore

likes.disliked: — The occasional longish wait for taxis

reviews.text: My wife and I wanted to get out of town for our anniversary and chose Singapore as our destination. It was our first time staying at a Shangri-la property, but it looked like just the place for a relaxing weekend. We couldn't have been happier with our choice.
reviews.title: Incredible Shagri-la!

reviews.text: Our first visit to Singapore and after travelling for past 2 weeks through Vietnam and Cambodia this is wonderful place to chill and relax in, the service by every single member of staff who we meet was a excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort style hotel away from the hustle and bustle , but close enough to walk to Orchard Road

reviews.text: Yes there is building work going on around pool and gardens, but this should not spoil the overall enjoyment of this hotel.
reviews.title: The best !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 minute walk to underground station at Orchard Road.
reviews.title: Good - but some money grabbing tactics

reviews.text: Stayed here with friends on our trip of a life time -- what a Hotel, this has to be the best in Singapore.Nothing disappointed, prices are reasonable for what you get, and that is 5 star treatment all the way.had a little problem with the plumbing but a word with reception had it sorted straight away. What more can I say -- an experience.
reviews.title: Shangri-La Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Horizon Club was excellent, and the enormous room/bathroom appreciated. However, when having a beer in the lobby lounge area on the ground floor, some snacks (nuts/chips) were placed on the table. To my horror these snacks were NOT complimentary, but incurred a $14 charge! Another disappointment was the bedding - it was not as comfortable as it could have been, especially the pillows (even after changing them). The Horizon Club drinks/nibbles were good, except the number of people who treated it as a free meal with their children made us uncomfortable and chose not to stay long - perhaps the food could be offered to guests rather than buffet style, to avoid the unpleasant feeding frenzy that occurred with these guests??
reviews.title: Superb
Great five star service....
reviews.text: We get to Singapore fairly regularly, and always stay at another, older hotel. However, the temptation of two nights paid for by Singapore Airlines made the Shangri La quite tempting. We were so pleased with our visit, that we would consider staying here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right from our early morning arrival at the hotel, the service was fantastic. I would have to say that the front desk clerk was one of the best I have ever encountered. Even though someone else was picking up the tab for our room, the front desk was totally focused on our needs and preferences, even well before check in time. I was so grateful for his kindness.
reviews.title: Trip of a life time
Absolutely fabulous!
reviews.text: I have never been a big fan of the Tower Wing at this hotel, and the rooms there are quite small, so if you have a lot of luggage, beware. However, the rooms are totally efficient and pleasant. and well-decorated with great linens The bathrooms have new mosaic tile and nice amenities. There is also free internet, and some spectacular views of the city. We were really quite pleased. The room attendant was first-rate, and always made sure the room was promptly serviced. She took a real interest in our comfort, and indeed in the appearance of the whole floor. A slight criticism I would have is that the hallway carpet and elevator carpet going up to the room looked like it could use a bit of a clean, if not replacement. Not horrible, but a bit tired. No significant complaints other than room size.

The pool at the Shang is great. A beautiful tropical atmosphere, and the hotel supplies plenty of reading material, which I thought was a nice touch. Lots of young families at the pool, but there was room for everyone, and anyone wanting to chill out had no problems.
reviews.title: Great Service - my fav hotel
simply the best
reviews.text: The Line, the Shang's main restaurant was GREAT. I was very pleased with the quality and variiety of the food. I was particularly impressed by how well kept the food was. For instance, instead of the warm juice you can encounter on some buffets, the Shang has a great refrigeration system. Everything that was supposed to be cold actually was....no room termperature stuff allowed. A really pleasant environment in which to enjoy your meal, as you look out over the Shang's verdant grounds. The hotel's physical site must be one of the most pleasant of any Singapore hotel.

description: Consistently ranked as one of the top luxury hotels in Asia and the world, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore is where the legendary hospitality of Shangri-La first began. The hotel, which sits amid 15 acres of luxuriant gardens and greenery, is a short stroll from the main entertainment and shopping belt of Orchard Road. This luxury hotel in Singapore comprises 747 luxury guestrooms and suites in three distinctive wings: the contemporary Tower Wing, the nature-inspired Garden Wing and the exclusive Valley Wing. There are also 15 acres of landscaped gardens, which is home to numerous plant and flower species, as well as a large school of luminous red and gold Japanese Koi residing in ponds filled by tumbling waterfalls.Inspired by nature, there is a daily Tai-Chi demonstration with a Tai-Chi master and Koi feeding ceremony by a Koi Master, in the Atrium of the new Garden Wing.A wide range of recreational facilities is available at the hotel, including the newly-opened CHI, The Spa at Shangri-La, 24-hour gym, a Jacuzzi, a sauna and steam room. Guests have the option of a game of tennis or having a swim in the freeform pool. There is a 3-hole golf course for putting practice.The hotel houses several dining outlets for great culinary experiences. From classical Japanese kaiseki at Nadaman to international favourites at The Line and the best of authentic Cantonese delicacies at Shang Palace, guests will enjoy excellent meals and ever-attentive service. A new dining concept, Waterfall Café, offers creative yet healthy cuisine. Guests can also relax with high tea served at The Rose Veranda which features 164 varieties of TWG teas, sip a Cheongsam, Shangri-La’s signature cocktail, in the Asian-inspired Lobby Court or savour premium wines amidst panoramic city views at BLU Bar.All guests will have access to the peaceful gardens, large free-form pool and world-class dining options. Guests will also enjoy signing privileges at the nearby Traders Hotel, Singapore and Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort on Sentosa Island. A business centre with internet and meeting room facilities is available for the convenience of the business travellers as well.
